subject: Re: [junit] How to run same testcase with 20 different  arg-values to test diff. results

messageBody:
>So said suyash_says on 2003-07-22 --------------------
>
> Hello every one. !!!
> Pls help me. i want to run the same testcase with 20
>different set of values of an arg that gives me 20 unique results. I
>don't want to hard code these values. Is there some dynamic way to do
>so that doesn't increase overheades of writing test case.
> Regds
> - Suyash

Yes, there is. Here is a sketch of the solution.

1. Add a constructor to your TestCase subclass that accepts the parameters you want to use for each test. Store those parameters in the test fixture (instance variables).
2. Create ONE test method that uses the test fixture and runs the test.
3. Create a suite() method that loops through your test data and uses your new constructor to push test data into the test fixture.

You can code your suite() method any way you want: it can read data from a file or a database, for example.

A more complete example will be available in the book "JUnit Cookbook" sometime in late 2003/early 2004. :)

Take care.
